00027 /*
00028  * CONSTRAINTS:
00029  *
00030  * Minimum page size is 2 ** XNHEAP_MINLOG2 (must be large enough to
00031  * hold a pointer).
00032  *
00033  * Maximum page size is 2 ** XNHEAP_MAXLOG2.
00034  *
00035  * Minimum block size equals the minimum page size.
00036  *
00037  * Requested block size smaller than the minimum block size is
00038  * rounded to the minimum block size.
00039  *
00040  * Requested block size larger than 2 times the page size is rounded
00041  * to the next page boundary and obtained from the free page
00042  * list. So we need a bucket for each power of two between
00043  * XNHEAP_MINLOG2 and XNHEAP_MAXLOG2 inclusive, plus one to honor
00044  * requests ranging from the maximum page size to twice this size.
00045  */
00046 
00047 #if defined(__KERNEL__) || defined(__XENO_SIM__)
00048 
00049 #define XNHEAP_MINLOG2    3
00050 #define XNHEAP_MAXLOG2    22    /* Must hold pagemap::bcount objects */
00051 #define XNHEAP_MINALLOCSZ (1 << XNHEAP_MINLOG2)
00052 #define XNHEAP_MINALIGNSZ (1 << 4) /* i.e. 16 bytes */
00053 #define XNHEAP_NBUCKETS   (XNHEAP_MAXLOG2 - XNHEAP_MINLOG2 + 2)
00054 #define XNHEAP_MAXEXTSZ   (1 << 31) /* i.e. 2Gb */
00055 
00056 #define XNHEAP_PFREE   0
00057 #define XNHEAP_PCONT   1
00058 #define XNHEAP_PLIST   2
00059 
00060 typedef struct xnextent {
00061 
00062         xnholder_t link;
00063 
00064 #define link2extent(ln) container_of(ln, xnextent_t, link)
00065 
00066         caddr_t membase,        /* Base address of the page array */
00067                 memlim,         /* Memory limit of page array */
00068                 freelist;       /* Head of the free page list */
00069 
00070         struct xnpagemap {      /* Beginning of page map */
00071                 unsigned int type : 8;    /* PFREE, PCONT, PLIST or log2 */
00072                 unsigned int bcount : 24; /* Number of active blocks. */
00073         } pagemap[1];
00074 
00075 } xnextent_t;
00076

00117 static inline size_t xnheap_align(size_t size, size_t al)
00118 {
00119         /* The alignment value must be a power of 2 */
00120         return ((size+al-1)&(~(al-1)));
00121 }
00122 
00123 static inline size_t xnheap_overhead(size_t hsize, size_t psize)
00124 {
00125         size_t m = psize / sizeof(struct xnpagemap);
00126         size_t q = (size_t)xnarch_llimd(hsize - sizeof(xnextent_t), m, m + 1);
00127         return xnheap_align(hsize - q, XNHEAP_MINALIGNSZ);
00128 }
00129 
00130 #define xnmalloc(size)     xnheap_alloc(&kheap,size)
00131 #define xnfree(ptr)        xnheap_free(&kheap,ptr)
00132 #define xnfreesync()       xnheap_finalize_free(&kheap)
00133 #define xnfreesafe(thread,ptr,ln)               \
00134     do {                                        \
00135     if (xnpod_current_p(thread))                \
00136         xnheap_schedule_free(&kheap,ptr,ln);    \
00137     else                                        \
00138         xnheap_free(&kheap,ptr);                \
00139 } while(0)
00140 
00141 static inline size_t xnheap_rounded_size(size_t hsize, size_t psize)
00142 {
00143         /*
00144          * Account for the minimum heap size (i.e. 2 * page size) plus
00145          * overhead so that the actual heap space is large enough to
00146          * match the requested size. Using a small page size for large
00147          * single-block heaps might reserve a lot of useless page map
00148          * memory, but this should never get pathological anyway,
00149          * since we only consume 4 bytes per page.
00150          */
00151         if (hsize < 2 * psize)
00152                 hsize = 2 * psize;
00153         hsize += xnheap_overhead(hsize, psize);
00154         return xnheap_align(hsize, psize);
00155 }
